rebate.translation[0].definitions[0].def: an amount of money that is paid back to you when you have paid too much tax, rent etc
rebate.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: You may be entitled to a tax rebate.
rebate.translation[1].definitions[0].def: an amount of money that is paid back to you when you have paid too much
rebate.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: You may be entitled to a tax rebate.
1.6 million tenants claimed a rent rebate.
You may get a rebate on your car insurance, if your car is off the road for at least 28 days.
rebate.translation[1].definitions[1].def: part of the price that is paid back to customers when they buy something
rebate.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Ford is offering a $2,000 rebate on this model.
rebate.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to pay part of the price of something back to customers when they buy it. In some places it can be illegal to do this
rebate.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: the agency’s practice of rebating to its clients part of the commission it receives from the sale of securities
rebate.translation[2].definitions[1].def: to pay an amount of money back to someone when they have paid too much
rebate.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: Council members want to rebate half the city’s $21 million surplus to taxpayers.
